meanings.definition: Remove from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The evil king was dethroned by the brave rebels.
meanings.sent2: The board unanimously decided to dethrone the corrupt CEO.
meanings.sent3: The power-hungry villain was dethroned from his lofty seat of control.
meanings.sent4: The sudden scandal dethroned the once-respected leader from his pedestal.
meanings.sent5: The people celebrated when they finally dethroned the oppressive ruler.

meanings.definition: Depose from a position of royalty or high office.
meanings.sent1: The queen was dethroned after the revolution.
meanings.sent2: The prince was dethroned due to his reckless behavior.
meanings.sent3: The royal cat was playfully dethroned from its favorite chair by a mischievous puppy.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events dethroned the heir apparent from his future crown.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse foretold that the king would be dethroned by his own kin.
